meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unsound.
meanings.sent1: The unsoundnesses of the old bridge were evident in its creaking and swaying.
meanings.sent2: The inspector noted several unsoundnesses in the foundation of the building.
meanings.sent3: The unsoundnesses of the leaky roof provided an unexpected indoor waterfall during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The unsoundnesses of the plan became apparent when everything started falling apart.
meanings.sent5: The unsoundnesses of the argument were exposed when no evidence could support it.

meanings.definition: A flaw or defect in something that makes it unreliable or unfit for use.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic discovered multiple unsoundnesses in the engine that needed immediate repair.
meanings.sent2: The unsoundnesses in the design of the product led to its recall from the market.
meanings.sent3: The unsoundnesses in the recipe resulted in a cake that tasted like soap.
meanings.sent4: The unsoundnesses in the relationship slowly eroded the trust between them.
meanings.sent5: The unsoundnesses in the logic of the statement made it difficult to believe.
